intro: Tabernaemontana sralensis, commonly known as the Sralen starflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes various species known for their showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
